Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, by completing it, its end is reached, and by the explanations and declarations contained therein, it seems to me that I fulfil this for you with this treatise, which is a part of the surgical operation with my hands.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the surgical operation is widespread in our region and in our time, deprived of everything, so that the knowledge of it, and its practice, is lost; and there remain only a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which have been misinterpreted and have led to error and hesitation, such that the understanding of it is clouded and its power and art are distant.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I will revive that [the surgical operation] through the organization of this treatise, following the path of exposition, declaration, and summarization; and so that it will come with the forms of cautery tools and other instruments of the craft, either by adding to the explanation, or by preparation for it, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the reason why a skilled craftsman is not found with his hands in our time is that the art of medicine is extensive, and its practitioner must previously be exercised in the science of anatomy, which encompasses the knowledge of the body's limbs and their forms, their connections and separations; and possess knowledge of the bones, nerves and tendons, their number, and their paths; and of the pulsing veins and quiet veins, and the locations of their origin.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for that reason Hippocrates says that by name it is much, but in practice little, and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said this in the introduction to this book; for whoever is not knowledgeable about what we have discussed regarding anatomy is not free from falling into error, by which men will die, as I have seen many such, for some are trained in this science and yet proceed without knowledge and without experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and unskilled physician attempt to lance a scrofulous abscess on a woman's neck, and cut some of the neck's arteries, so that much blood flowed until the woman died in his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another physician attempt to remove a stone from a man who had reached old age, and the stone was large, and he went to the man and extracted the stone along with a piece of the bladder, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I already, having fled to escape it, saw that because of the size of the stone and the disposition of the patient, I knew beforehand that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another physician who received a stipend from a duke in our land for surgery, and went to a dark-skinned man whose thigh was fractured; and through the physician's ignorance, he attempted to fix the fracture, over the wound, with splints and bandages with great force, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he unbound it according to his desires, and then he reapplied it, and then left it for several days and ordered that we unbind the ligature; and it remained like that until the thigh and the leg became abscessed, and he ended up perishing.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I proceeded to loosen the ligature, and tranquility was achieved, and thus he was relieved of his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, already corruption had taken hold in the limb, so that I could not restrain it, and the corruption continued to spread in the limb until the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another physician who opened a cancerous abscess, and it became ulcerated over several days, until the severity of it was magnified by the patient's condition.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Because the cancerous wound is purely of melancholic humor, therefore it should not be treated with complete cauterization, but rather the limb in which it occurs should be amputated entirely.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, children, it is necessary for you that the surgical procedure be divided into two parts: one is the procedure associated with healing, and the other is the work which poses risk in the most critical cases.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already shown this throughout this book where the operation involves mistakes and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to avoid this and abandon it, so that bad words find no way to speak ill of you and disgrace you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	Therefore, take your tools with diligence and God's protection, and treat your patients with kindness and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best methods, by God's grace, seeking health and praiseworthy success, and leave the terrible illnesses of difficult cure, and remove from your tools that which causes you fear, so that the reputation of your skill and your name is not lost: for greater is remaining glory, and more exalted in the world, and behind your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Guilia already said in some of his teachings/instructions:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat a serious illness, so that you are not called bad doctors.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The division of the book begins, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter is ordered from head to foot, regarding the forms of instruments and the tools of cauteries, and what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on cutting and piercing, and on cupping, and on poultices, and on the extraction of arrows and similar things, is entirely categorized and ordered by the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the treatment of twisting and similar things; a chapter ordered from head to foot, and regarding the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cauterization with fire and with sharp medicine and a reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	It is necessary for me to describe the benefits of this cautery and its harms, and in which constitution cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the discourse on the benefits and harms of cautery is long, verbose, scientifically subtle, and secretly hidden; and many learned people have spoken about it, and they have disagreed, and it suffices for me to take a little from their discourse, fearing to be too lengthy.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery benefits every constitution universally, whether with or without matter, except for two constitutions, which are hot constitutions without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the hot and dry constitution with matter, there is disagreement; for some say that cautery is helpful in that case, and others say the opposite, that cautery is not appropriate in an illness caused by heat and dryness, because the nature of fire is heat and dryness, and it is inconvenient that a hot and dry illness be cured with something that is also hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he who says the opposite argues that cautery is beneficial in all hot and dry illnesses affecting the body, because when you compare the body and its humours to the constitution of fire, you find the human body to be cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say, based on this argument, that experience has shown me this to be true on several occasions.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, this should not be taken by someone who has not already been experienced and practiced in the chapter on cautery, and who has not learned about the diversity of human constitutions and the nature of illnesses, their causes, their symptoms, and the time frame in which they occur.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other constitutions, there is no such concern, and especially in cold and moist illnesses, for all doctors have agreed upon this, and are not divided on the use of cautery in these cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that the secret of curing with cautery by fire, and its efficacy, rests in contrast to cauterizing with a burning medicine, for fire is simple, its action only reaches the part cauterized, and does not harm other parts associated with it, except for minor damage.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of burning medicine extends to those parts of the body located further away, and it easily causes difficult-to-heal illnesses and severe pain in the affected area.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	However, fire, due to its inherent nature and goodness, does not cause this, but only superfluity.  And we already know this from experiment and from the long study of the art, regarding the truth of causes; therefore, I am excused from a lengthy explanation.  And if it were not that my book, on this topic,  conceals the secret of treating with fire, and its effect on the body, and the manner in which it expels diseases, with a philosophical, demonstrable discussion – that would be a matter suitable to your wisdom.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree on the time when it is best to apply cautery, and they suggest the best time is spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is appropriate at any time, because the harm from accidental timing is outweighed by the benefit derived from the cautery, especially if the cautery is for painful or necessary conditions, intense and urgent, which cannot tolerate delay because the feared harm is greater than the minor harm resulting from the timing.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this does not apply to your wisdom, or children, this is only considered by the ignorant populace and foolish physicians, that is, that not every illness treated with cautery is a cure for all time, and they fail to consider this consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not at all as they suppose, for cautery is only a method of medicine that alters the complexion and dries the humidity which is the cause of pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But nevertheless, cautery is superior to other medical treatments because of its power, its effectiveness, and the greatness of its master.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the illness may return at some time, depending on the patient's constitution, the location of the illness, the patient's strength, and the accumulation of superfluities within the body, and what they have consumed in food and similar matters;  however, if the illness for which cautery is administered is a subtle ailment in a limb with few superfluities and humors, like toothache and similar conditions, it is possible that the pain will not return, but this is usually a short-term effect.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is a common saying that cautery is the last resort in medicine, and it is a true statement, not in the way they understand it, for they believe there is no cure that is as effective as cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The truth is the opposite.  The idea that cautery is the last resort in medicine is only true when we have tried other methods of treatment for some illnesses, and those treatments are ineffective, and only then is cautery used as a last resort, and it can be effective in that situation.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	Therefore, the idea that cautery is the last resort in medicine is not as the common people and foolish doctors understand it.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	The ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this without reason, due to the equal and superior nature of gold's substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the location for cautery does not matter, but this is not entirely true, for I have proven this and found that it only works on certain bodies, not others, and cautery with gold is indeed better than with iron as they said; however, when you use gold to cauterize with fire, it's not as straightforward as they describe, because it burns away in proportion to how much you want it to through the gold's hardness, and because it prepares to receive cold; and if you add a flame to it, the gold melts with the heat, and some gold slips into the fire, so the craftsman loses it through this procedure.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	Therefore, cautery with iron is done more easily and more accurately with respect to the correct execution of the procedure.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have organized this chapter on cautery according to sections, and have ordered them from head to feet, so that the inquirer can find what they want in it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery for headaches caused by cold and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization treats the moisture and cold affecting the brain, the causes of which are twofold: one is the cause of a cold, copious rheumatic flux, called a cold, flowing from the head to the parts of the eyes and ears, and copious sleep, and toothache and sore throat, and generally any illness arising from cold, such as paralysis, apoplexy, and similar ailments.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method for this cauterization is this: first, you instruct the patient to take a laxative to cleanse the head for three or four nights, according to the patient's strength, age, and usual constitution.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then instruct him to shave his head, and then place him on a smooth bench with your hands on his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the blade of your palm near the bridge of his nose between his eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, when the middle finger has reached that spot, mark the spot with a probe, and then apply the olive cautery, the form of which is as follows:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	Then place that [cautery] on the spot marked by the probe, so that it descends, while your hand is gradually tightened, and you rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Then gently remove your hand and observe the area.  If you see any significant portion of bone exposed, roughly the size of a grain of millet, then raise your hand; if not, return your hand with that iron, and with another of the same kind, if it is chilled, until you can see the bone as I have described to you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	Then take a small amount of salt and dissolve it over the area, and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then apply a cloth soaked in water and leave it there until the scab from the fire has been destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with tetrafarmacon unguent until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And if the wound remains open, it is better to raise the arm, as this is more beneficial and helpful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the bone should be cauterized down to the bone, and the cautery should be held until some part of the bone's tissue is burned.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then whatever is burned to the bone should be scraped off, and then treated.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that with the cautery they should reach the back [of the affected area], applying strong pressure until the bone breaks, and this is the method of minor cauterization:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that place, the vapors of the head are escaping.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and then treated until it is healed.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	However, I have not seen these two types of cauterization in all cases, but only in some men, according to a fearful method;  and, in my view, better is healing, when possible; for the head is weakened by a rupture of its continuity, just as we have witnessed in other members, and especially when the patient's head is of frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and better in my opinion; and with that method and work, there is healing.
Capitol segon.	Second Chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cauterization of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and prolonged pain affects the entire head of a prolonged illness, and remedies such as leeches, cupping, head purges, plasters, compresses, poultices, and similar treatments have been used, and especially if the head has already been cauterized with a cautery that doesn't benefit from any of those remedies, then consider this: if the patient's head is strong in its nature, and isn't frail, but shows a significant amount of cold, then cauterize below the first cautery a little.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that area above the patient's temple with a cautery until the skin is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut through the skin until the bone is exposed to the extent we have described, and cauterize that with a cautery on the back of the head in the area called the "vas" – which is the location where a cupping vessel is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And ease your hand in doing this, and do not expose the bone, for the patient will experience very great pain, different from the pain of other cauterizations of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will say this about the cautery in its place, for the cautery used to cauterize the temples and the back of the head should be a finer cautery than the one used for the middle of the head; and this is the way to do it.
Capitol ters.	Third Chapter.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Concerning the cauterization of non-chronic migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is persistent pain in the head, or pain that extends to the eye, the head should be purged with medicaments, and the other treatments mentioned in my descriptions of illnesses should be administered.  If all else fails, cauterization in such cases can be done in two ways: either with a sharp, burning medicament, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	However, cauterization with a burning medicine is done by taking a clove of garlic, squeezing it, and scraping the ends of it from both ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then, you should cut the painful area on the temple with a sharp lancet, until a small pit is formed under the skin, so that it is concealed.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then, apply pressure to it with a compress to constrict it, and leave it in place for three hours.  Then remove it, and take away the garlic, and leave the wound for two or three days.  Then, apply a cotton pad soaked in vinegar, until the area is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines, which I have written about in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But cauterization with iron, according to this method: heat the cautery iron, for which this is the procedure:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called "clavus clavillis," because the head of it is shaped like a nail, in which there is some curvature, and in the middle of it is a small protrusion.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then place it on the painful area, and hold your hand (so that the underlying artery is not harmed) and turn the iron little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount adhered by the sharpness of the cautery is about half of it, then lift your hand so that the artery underneath isn't harmed, so that there isn't a flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then soak cotton in salt water and place it on the area, and leave it for three days; and then place cotton soaked in butter, and then treat with ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize with the tip of the scalpel, according to cautery, and be careful not to cut an artery in this particular, not-ancient, procedure.
Capitol quart.	Fourth Chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cauterization of ancient migraines.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat a migraine with what we have said about the previous treatment, and what we have said in the divisions of diseases, and the treatment is not effective, and sometimes because the illness does not respond to what we have said about the first cauterization with medicine or cauterization with fire, then you should heat the scalpel cautery until it is white-hot, then apply it to the painful area in a long line, about half the length of a finger, or a little less; and hold your hand steady until you cut the artery and reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be careful about the continuity of the jaw, which is strained by chewing, and that the ligaments and nerves that control it are not inflamed or cause spasms.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about guarding and being careful of the flow of blood from the severed artery, because in severing it there is fear, especially for someone who doesn't understand what they are doing and is not skilled and experienced; and leaves the operation incomplete at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come back to the treatment of accidental blood flow from the artery according to its method, in its place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this treatment is not effective for this illness and see the patient's condition is tolerable, cauterize the affected area in the middle of the head as we have described, and treat the wound until it heals.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, apply the cautery we mentioned in the chapter on artery constriction with a cautery having two blades; this is a better and more effective cauterization.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of cauterization for ear pains.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When pain in the ear comes from cold and is treated with laxative remedies and other treatments as previously described, and the pain does not subside, then apply the cautery, specifically the one called 'puncta', of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then, apply the heated cautery point near the ignition, and move it around the entire ear, in a circular motion, or on each affected spot if the pain is localized.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Move the cautery along the ear's base, slowly, after marking the location with a probe.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery makes ten points on the whole ear, then treat those areas until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of the cauterization of tumors.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Tumors which are cured by cauterization are only of the types that come from phlegm, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the type that comes from dryness or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that type of tumor with poultices, emetics, and other remedies, and your treatment is unsuccessful, then you must cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first at the root of the ear, the second a little below the temple, and the third at the junction of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery on the opposite side of the diseased area, for softening only occurs in the healthy-appearing area.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the method of cauterization is to cauterize at the right side of the ear's extremity, a little above the temple bone; and another at the temple, the length of which should be equal to the length of the finger (or thumb), and hold the cautery until about half of the affected area is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the method of cauterization, and it is a type of surgery, the method of which is described beforehand.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is more subtle than what you have seen; and the knife should remove a little of the excess fat.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with what has been previously described until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Concerning the cauterization of old apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old, and you have treated it with what we have described, and your treatment is not effective, and the patient has no fever, then cauterize the patient with four cauteries: on each temple, and with a cautery in the middle of the head, as we have said, and with a cautery on the throat.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of cauterization is done according to what has been stated above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and it is further back; and soon after it should be treated with what you proceed with.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of cauterization for forgetfulness, done by fire.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Large jars and pills must be given to the patient at the beginning, to purify the brain.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then shave the entire head of the patient and place a plaster of the kind described in the treatise on plasters on their forehead.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply it several times, for that is a way of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to the same order which I have already described.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And so, if this treatment is successful; and if not, then apply three cauteries to the back of their head, descending from the highest part of the head to the lowest part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place the width of a finger between each cautery, and then treat the cautery with what has been previously described.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you desire more and the patient tolerates it, then apply a cautery to the middle part; and if you desire even more, then cauterize it above the two horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat it until it is healed; and let the cautery be olive-shaped, according to the form previously given.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Concerning the cauterization of paralysis and the softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	You should proceed with the cleansing of the head with herbs and what we have said; and then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head, and with cauteries on all the horns of the head, and with a cautery on the back part of it, and with three cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if in the disease of softening of the body, the patient is weak and the illness is severe, then cauterize the patient with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and continuously with a cautery until it is softened considerably, and remove your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then treat him until he is healed, and this should be an olive oil cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Concerning the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized unless the epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	Therefore, it is necessary to treat his brain at the beginning with herbs and the other treatment we have described in the division when the illness is severe and can tolerate the exception of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not tolerate the medicines, then administer balms and masticatories that will treat the brain, beforehand for many days, with good dietary adjustments.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head, according to the previous method, and with another cautery on the back of his head, and cauterize on each of his temples.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the illness is severe and can tolerate it, then cauterize it with the cauteries I have mentioned, having simultaneously paralysis and softening of the body upon the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	Let the cautery be olive-oil based, as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then apply a delicate cautery according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Concerning the cauterization of melancholia.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholia are corrupted humidity and thick phlegm, then cauterize it with the cauteries we have mentioned in the section on paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholia is a superfluity inclining towards melancholia, and the patient's body is moist, then give him to drink what purifies his brain, according to what has been stated previously in the division (or section).
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the patient's head, and then apply a properly made cupping glass to the area of the scalp, and place it in the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should be seated upright, and held steady on all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply a liniment; and a good old sheep's wool is most suitable.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And warm that over the fire with a moderate heat, which the patient can tolerate when it is placed on him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then place that in the middle of the patient's head, within the cupping glass, and leave it until it cools.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this with the patient once a week, with the other treatment for him until he is healed; or if you want, cauterize that by making small punctures according to the patient's tolerance, but keep your hand with a cautery prepared in this way: this type of cautery moistens the brain evenly.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that cloth soaked in broth or hen's grease.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the cauterization of descending water in the ear.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have observed the beginning of water in the ear, based on the signs I described in the division, then begin and give the patient to drink something that will dry his head and protect it from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And have him sweat in a bath for a few days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then command him to shave his head and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head; and then cauterize it with two cauteries on the two temples if it is the beginning of the spreading of water in both ears, or on one side if it is the beginning of water in one ear.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cut with a cautery all the veins and arteries that are under the skin; and let the cauteries be at that length, in the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And beware of blood flows when it is cauterized; and if you see blood flows from him, stop them with any medicine that is possible for you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will come with the knowledge that is in the extraction of arteries and with the excision of those and caution about blood flows.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized on the neck, under two bones, with two cauteries placed directly upon them.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of the cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears of the eyes are old, persistent, and through the veins and arteries which are apparent in the area of the head's exterior, and it is verified that this is excess of cold phlegmatic material, then cauterize that area with the cautery that we described in the chapter of heating water in the eyes,  and use a cautery in the middle of the head and two cauteries in the neck below the temples, and two cauteries in the neck below the bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if more treatment is needed, then cauterize that area along the entire side of the eye socket on the browbone/eyebrow area with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of the cauterization of nasal foul odor.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	If your treatment with the methods we've discussed in the previous section is ineffective, then prepare and give the patient decoctions to drink for three nights; then shave his head, and cauterize it with a medium-sized cautery and an olive-oil-based cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize the area with a clove-shaped cautery, using two cauteries, one small one above each eyebrow under the hair.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful of the flame, so that you do not burn it.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the shape of the clove-shaped cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cauterization for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery using this lunar cautery; and this is its shape:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, cauterize that area above the two eyebrows a little with two cauteries on every side, and let them extend away from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the amount of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand too hard with the cautery, but just enough that the third part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Concerning cauterization of the eyelid when the hairs are turned inward and cause the eye to become inflamed.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eye are turned inward causing inflammation, cauterization in those cases is done in two ways: either with a burning iron or with a medicinal burn.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If with a cautery of fire, first instruct the patient to remove the hairs as one would shave them, until they are pulled out and cut; and if the inflammation is near the eyelashes, then you should bandage the eye to prevent movement until the hairs have grown back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then, once the hairs have grown back and are trimmed, place the patient's head on your lap, and carefully make a mark on the eyelid with a probe, marking it with a shape similar to a myrtle leaf, starting near the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then place cotton soaked in egg white or in a poultice of ptilli on the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then apply the cautery, which has this form.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize over the marked area, little by little, multiple times, until the surface of the inflamed area, which resembles a myrtle leaf, is completely burned.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	A sign of successful treatment is that you see the eyelid contracted and the hairs raised towards the eye's puncture point.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then lift your hand and leave it for three days, and then place cotton with a bandage over it until the scab has healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if any cause returns to the hairs' origin, and the eyelid is softened, then repeat the cauterization in the same way as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are beneath the eyelid, then cauterize them until they are raised to their natural position, and are smoothed so the hairs no longer irritate the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with a burning medicine, which is what you order the patient to do, is to let the hairs grow out and smooth them, and then a leaf-shaped piece of cloth is made in the shape of a myrtle leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take known herbs and living vinegar.  And mix those things well, and do this quickly so it doesn't get cold; and then spread this mixture onto the cloth shaped like a myrtle leaf, and place this over the affected eye or both eyes; and put a cloth soaked in egg white under the eye, and the patient's head should be supported by you.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place your finger on the medicine and press it slightly, but do not remove it until the patient feels the medicine's burning sensation, for the burning sensation should be like that of fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And when the patient perceives the burning sensation, then remove the medicine and wash it away with your finger; then, when the burning subsides, remove the medicine and wash the eye with water.  Then consider if the eyelid has been raised as intended through the burning or incision, because if it is, then the procedure is complete; and if not, return to applying the medicine to the area not previously treated, and don't stop until the procedure is successful and the eye is healed.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then apply a cloth over it until the burn's pain is gone, and then treat it with a healing ointment or another treatment until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, in the course of your treatment, to carefully watch that nothing of the medicine gets into the eye.  And if, after a few days, the eyelid is softened and any hairs have fallen into the eye, then reapply your medicine to the softened part of the eyelid, just as you did at first, and continue until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the method using myrtle leaves.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the eyes of men vary in size and smallness, and therefore your treatment is tailored accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the path to recovery will not be hidden from the one who studies this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of the cauterization of fistulas that are in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula using the methods described in the divisions of diseases, and your treatment isn't successful, you must cauterize it in this way: instruct the patient to place their head on your lap, and have another attendant hold the patient's head between your hands, so it doesn't move or shake.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place a piece of cotton soaked in egg white or in a ptilli mucilage (plant based adhesive) on the patient's eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then apply the cautery, which has this form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is concave, like the shape of a reed or a hawk's feather, on the end where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if desired, it can be pointed at the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, it can be shaped like a probe.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the concave one is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and drain and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and remove the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place the cautery, which is well-heated, upon it, and hold your hand a short distance from the cautery near the edge of the nostril, so that neither your hand nor the patient is disturbed, and then place the cautery on the edge of the nostril and cauterize it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if at the beginning your cautery penetrates the bone, it is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice, if needed; and leave it thus for three days, and then apply a bandage with a cloth and surround it with a drying ointment until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if more than ten days have passed and it is not healed, then apply a sharp, corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and is scraped as is appropriate in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another way of cauterizing a fistula, which some earlier practitioners said:  Cut into the place of the fistula and make it open, then place into that fissure a thin strip of material of which its form is [described] (or: shape). And pour into this fissure a quantity of melted lead, hold your hand to steady it (and be sure it is applied correctly) so that the melted lead does not injure the opening; and you should place on the opening of the patient a bandage soaked in albumen (egg white) or water, because the lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it with a marvelous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed by what we have mentioned about the cautery and its treatment, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer a treatment through the nose and reduce the fistula to the nasal passage according to its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of the fissure (or split) of the pot (or possibly:  of the abscess).
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Often fissures occur in the lips, especially in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, if you treat those fissures with what we have described in the previous sections and your treatment is not effective, then apply a small, knife-like cautery in this manner (which follows):
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And its (the cautery's) concavity should be according to the sharpness of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then carefully place that heated cautery on those fissures until the cautery reaches the bottom of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with a plaster until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cauterization of fistulas in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an abscess develops at the root of the uvula, or on the palate, or at the roots of the teeth, and it then forms a fistula, and it breaks open, and becomes chronic, and pus flows and a fistula is formed, and you treat it, and it does not respond to treatment, then you must apply a cautery according to the size of the opening in the fistula, and then place that heated cautery into the opening of the fistula, and hold it until the hot iron reaches the bottom of it, and do this one or two times; and then treat it with whatever we have said about treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And therefore, if the pus is removed and the wound is healed, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to expose the area and remove the corrupted bone, as described in its corresponding chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cauterization of the teeth and softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are decayed, and you treat them with medicines, but it does not help, then place the patient's head in your lap, and then heat the cautery, the shape of which will be appropriate, so that you position the cannula over the tooth and quickly insert the heated cautery into it, holding it a short time until the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then remove your hand, and then repeat the cauterization several times as you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should fill their mouth with salt water and keep it in for an hour, and then spit it out, for the decayed tooth is sealed, the softened gums are strengthened, and the corrupted moisture is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of the cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by cold, or there is cold or a worm inside, or you do not consider medical treatment appropriate, then cauterization in that case is done in two ways: either cauterization with cow dung or cauterization with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with dung is done by taking cow dung, boiling it in an iron pot, and then taking a piece of cloth and wrapping it around the tip of a probe.  Then, dip that cloth in the boiled dung and quickly place it on the aching tooth until it cools down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat this several times until the heat's effect reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, you can soak wool or cloth in the aforementioned dung and place it over the aching tooth, then place a heated iron on top of that until the iron reaches the point of the tooth's cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cauterization with fire involves taking a heated needle or iron, ensuring it has enough thickness so that the heat doesn't reach the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then heat the cautery, the shape of which will be appropriate, and place it on the tooth while holding it until the cautery cools.  Do this several times, for the pain will cease either that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary that, through the pressure of the cautery, the patient fill their mouth with good dung and hold it for an hour, then spit it out; and this is the method of cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize any extremity you can, as is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the method of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of cauterization of extrophulos.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When extrophulos are caused by phlegm and cold humors and are not responsive to digestion through medicines, and you desire to ease their digestion, then you ignite the cautery, whose shape is as follows: having two open ends so that smoke may escape from the cautery from the other end.  Place this ignited cautery on that abscess once, and again if needed, until you reach the base of the abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the abscess is small, then place the cautery according to the size of the abscess, and leave it in place for three days, and put on it a cloth soaked in water until what the fire has burned is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment, bandages, and dressings until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the cannula or cautery should be suitable for such a procedure.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cauterization of hoarseness of voice and constriction of the throat.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When moisture gathers in the lung's passages, especially when this is due to a cold constitution, the patient should initially be treated with laxative medicines, and then cauterized near the root of the windpipe, in the affected area.
