Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if this happens to someone and the physician is not present, nor is medicine available, then, using gentle pressure of the index finger on the opening of the vein as we have said, proceed to strongly compress it until the blood is stopped from its outward flow, and the finger should not be removed from the artery; and above the artery, it should be sprinkled with very cold water until the blood is congealed and thickened;  and further action, whether with cautery or medicine, is necessary.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incisions and perforations, leeches, phlebotomy, sores, and similar afflictions.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already discussed in the first chapter all illnesses for which cauterization with fire and comburent medicines are appropriate, along with the occasions and causes for them, and the necessary instruments with the forms of the cauteries; and I have organized the chapters from the head down to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And I will proceed in this chapter in the same manner, so that the seeker of this knowledge will be relieved, concerning whatever they have inquired about.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before I begin this, children, it is necessary to understand that in this chapter, the content is related to the first chapter on cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And for this reason, great care is required, because in the operations of this chapter, many times, the evacuation necessary for life is achieved through bloodletting, be it by incision of a vein, or an incision on an abscess or an opening for discharge, or the removal of a foreign object, or extracting a dart, or the incision of a stone, and similar procedures.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And all of those are accompanied by fear and trembling, and in the hands of those who do them lies death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that this should not happen to you, for sometimes you will encounter men with many kinds of illnesses.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And some of them will become enraged by their illness, and death is near for them, due to the severity of their illness, and the length of their suffering, and with the illness comes fear, which signifies death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And of those is the one who gives you their belongings and says, "You are hoping for health," and their illness is harmful.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	Therefore, you should not agree to the one who comes to you in this manner; let your caution be greater than your desire and your recklessness.  Do not presume any cause upon this, but only with certain knowledge which verifies this to you, and with which comes a praiseworthy outcome.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	Practice in the treatment of all your patients with prognosis and indication to that which is converted to health, for in that is help for you in gaining fame and memory, praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh, children, may God inspire your understanding and do not deprive yourselves of his guidance and protection, for this is in his power.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have organized this chapter, distinguishing it by sections, as was previously done in the chapter on cauteries, concerning the treatment from the head to the feet, so that this will alleviate what you seek and of which you have need.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the treatment of water contained in the heads of children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this ailment often affects children around the time of birth, and when the nurse tightens the child's head without gentleness.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes it occurs due to a hidden cause that is unknown.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	However, I have only seen this illness in children; and all those I saw it in died, and thus I am convinced it is a hopeless case in such patients.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen a child whose head was filled with water, and his head was constantly swelling until he could no longer support himself because of the size of his head, and that the moisture continued to increase until he died.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this moisture is either accumulated between the skull and the bone, or accumulated beneath the bone on the spinal column.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	When the treatment for this condition, where the moisture is between the skull and the bone and the abscess is small, you should make an incision in the middle of the head,  a slit whose length is about two inches, until the moisture flows out.  This is the method of treatment for this condition (or, this is the form of the operation).
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And therefore, if the moisture is more extensive and the abscess larger, then there are two incisions in this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the moisture is beneath the bone, a sign of this is that you see the seams of the skull open on all sides, and the water is squeezed out when you press on it with your hand in various places, and this is not hidden from you.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	You should make an incision in the middle of the head using three slits in this manner:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	Then remove all the moisture from the incision; then tighten the slits with cloths and dressings; then apply wine and oil to it until the fifth day, and then loosen the bandage and treat the wound with dressings and ointments, and support the head evenly; and the patient should eat dry foods with low moisture content until the affected area is strengthened and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another method of incision, where you consider the size of the abscess and the collection of water, for sometimes it is more in the back of the head, or in the front, or on the right, or on the left; and therefore, make the incision where the abscess and the collection of water appear, and do it in the way that seems best to you.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And be careful not to cut the artery, lest blood flow out and the patient die from that blood loss and the evacuation of moisture.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter 2.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of the incision of the arteries which are near the ears, called "hilasseysse".
Capitol segon.	Second chapter.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When there is persistent catarrh or inflammation in the eyes or foot, and the usual medicines are not effective, then the final treatment in this case is the incision of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore, when you want to incise those, if the patient is holding their head, rub the area with a rough cloth to expose the arteries, then tie the patient's head with a cloth; then consider where the vein pulses; and mark the spots on each side near the ears, because they are hidden in some people.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then mark the artery with a probe, and then cut each one with a sharp incision, penetrating the bone, and do so at the width of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you wish, insert the probe under the artery and sever it at the points above.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And the length of the incision should be about two fingers wide, for when any vein is cut, the blood flows out with a pulsating exit, which jumps out frequently.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery is not visible, then you should measure from the ear the distance of three fingers, and then mark it with a probe and cut to the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And the amount of blood that needs to be drawn is about one ounce, and the amount may vary more or less, and all this depends on the strength of the patient and the fullness of their artery.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then consider the wound, and if any cause of inflammation remains on the bone, then cut that out so that a hot abscess does not develop.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the wound with bandages and linen strips, and then treat it with ointments until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter 3.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Of the extraction of arteries which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When, in some cases, you encounter chronic migraines or severe headaches, caused by irritating moisture and by the quality of inflammation in the temples, or a sudden severe pain resembling these, and treatment with the established methods of medicine is not effective, then we have proven effective in such ailments the extraction of arteries in the temples, or cauterization of those as described previously.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the method of the operation and extraction of those arteries is that the patient shaves the hair which is on the temples; and notice the artery appearing in the temple as it is shown to you by its pulse, and it is hidden except to a few people because of the violence of the cold.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden from you, then the patient's neck should be tightened with some cloth; and then rub the area with a rough cloth or apply hot water to the area until the artery appears clearly to you.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then you take the instrument, which has this shape:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then you carefully slice the skin with that instrument until you reach the artery; and then you apply cautery to the area and extract that artery in a systematic way until you pull it free from the surrounding tissues and expose those beneath it, from all sides.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is thin, then wrap it with the tip of the cautery, and then cut off a portion according to the extent to which its ends are lengthened and drawn together, so that there will be no blood flow; for if it is not severed, the blood will not fully recede.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then drain the blood from a vein one to three times.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is large, then you must tie it in two places with strong double-stitched silk or long cords, and do not cut it until the wound has healed and blood flow ceases.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then you cut away the excess tissue that lies between two ligaments; and do this at that time or at another time.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you wish, cauterize that with a cautery, even to the bone, with a scalpel cautery, until its ends are cut, and the same action will take place there.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is a better course of action if the patient does not have a fever or is not of a hot temperament; for cauterization is one of those things that helps to remove moisture, and thus it is better for curing.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary, after removing the arteries, that the area be filled with old lint and be sprinkled with properly prepared powders, and then be treated with drying medicines that promote flesh growth, and with poultices until it heals.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if, while working, there is a further flow of blood from the artery, then you must try to stop that blood, either with a cautery, or by filling the area with lint, and pressing your hand until the blood is stopped.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if none of those things is at hand, then place your finger on the area until the blood is congealed, and apply water of great coldness to the area until the pain subsides, and it is constricted as needed.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And the easiest way to remove an artery is to cauterize the vein with this cautery, having two blades, after marking the two spots with a probe, and making each one extremely hot, until they reach the bone and cut the vein in two places, so that what is between the ends of it is stretched, because they are not completely consolidated by this cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And the sharpness of the two blades is important.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	However, if the sharpness is less than that of two blades, it is better, for if it is sharp like two blades close to each other, it will not cut the flesh quickly.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, since there is some thickness in those [blades], the heat of the fire is maintained in them, and the flesh is cut easily.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this method is better than any other method and is more convenient.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And the space between the two blades should be the width of a finger.
Capitol quart.	Fourth Chapter.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	Of the treatment of bodies afflicted with acute and acrid humors in the eyes.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When the eyes are acrid, and the vessels beneath the scalp become inflamed, and you find no medicinal cause for their treatment, and sometimes the patient's face begins to redden, and they feel a crawling sensation on their forehead as if ants were crawling, and the eyes are weakened, moist, to the point that their skin is blurred, and the eyelids are burning due to the sharpness of the tears,  ancient healers faced difficulties in treating these cases and often called upon a variety of procedures.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you instruct the patient to shave the hair on their forehead, and then make three equally spaced incisions across the forehead, following its length.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the incision is two fingers long: one incision should be centered on the forehead, directly above the bridge of the nose; the second should be positioned slightly along the length of the space between the eyes; the third at the other end of the forehead.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And be careful not to cut the arteries which are located on both sides, and keep your hand away from continuing the incision through both jaws.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space between each incision is the width of three fingers.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a piece of prepared sponge or very dry cloths with which to soak up the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And then insert the spatula with two sharp ends, of which this is the shape of the incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which is from the temple area up to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Scrape with that the entire membrane which is between the two incisions with the chisel that is over the bone, and then do this from the middle incision up to the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then remove this spatula and insert into the first incision again another instrument, which is called a knife, sharp on one side and not sharp on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And place the blade of that sharp part against the flesh adjacent to the membrane, and its handle against the bone, and push it until it reaches the middle fissure, and cut with that all the vessels that descend from the head to the eyes.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	But let the incision continue in this way on the membrane, and then do this in the middle fissure until the other fissure.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And since a quantity of congealed blood flows, express the places of the congealed blood clots.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then place in each fissure a piece of old cloth, and put on those powders mixed with wine, oil, and sour wine, and make sure that no hot abscess develops.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day, loosen the ligament and administer a large infusion of warm or lukewarm water, and then treat it with basil ointment with rubbed oil and others until the wounds are healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Concerning the treatment of sores and descending ulcers in the parts within the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When a person experiences sharp and persistent sores, and the patient's ulcers are small and spreading, and the healing of them is weakened, and the eyelids are ulcerated and the skin around them is affected, and there is a sharp and debilitating pain in the scalp area, then know from these symptoms that the sores and ulcers come from a multitude of veins in the parts of the head itself.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best treatment in these cases is this: order the patient to shave their forehead, and then make a small incision in the middle of the forehead (starting with an incision from the left temple to the right temple; and the incision should go down to the bone; and carefully move your hand away from the temporal lacerations, which are likely to cause further problems during chewing), until the bone is exposed.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry all the blood with a sponge or a dry cloth, and then fill the gap between the two edges of the incision with old cloth or linen.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then apply a poultice made of powders mixed with wine and oil, to prevent a painful abscess from forming.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you remove this and see that the abscess has begun to diminish, then you must clean the bone until flesh begins to grow, and then treat it with a drying regimen that encourages flesh growth, just as if you take two parts wheat flour and four parts colophony and mix them, making a plaster from this, which should be applied to these wounds to promote the growth of new flesh.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	Of the treatment of that which affects the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	Every ailment affecting the ears belongs to one of four categories: either a mineral, or something resembling a mineral, such as iron or glass; or a plant, such as a thorn or bean; or a fluid substance, such as water, sour wine, and similar liquids; or an animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And therefore, when a stone or a similar substance that doesn't adhere or grow in the ear is lodged there, and you expose the ear to the sun, and if you can dislodge the stone, then instill into it some kind of violet or cedar oil, and then remove it, and make the person sneeze with some remedy, and block the nostrils to support the sneezing action.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then place some cloths or wool around the ear, and stretch the ear outward, for often it can be forced out by these methods.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it isn't forced out, then administer extraction with a tool called a *gesti epicicarios subtil*, of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is forced out with the instrument, good; and if not, then administer extraction with a thin, slightly curved implement.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And therefore, if it is not forced out by that, then make a copper cannula and insert the end of the cannula into the ear canal, and seal around the cannula with softened wax and oil, so that only the cannula is open.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	Then extract with your hand with strong traction, for often with this method we have had success.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not forced out in this way, then take a lit candle or a similar tool used to hold small birds, and place it on the wound's edge, and then gently wrap cloth around it.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then gently insert that into the ear canal, and then dry the ear of moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And therefore, if it is not forced out with all the methods we have described, then you should consider cutting it open before it becomes a painful abscess or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the method of cutting it is that you first bleed the patient from the cephalic vein, and draw out blood according to its nature, and then make a cut between your hands and turn the ear to its upper parts, and make a small incision at the root of the ear towards its thickest part, at a place that is well pressed by you.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And let the incision be in the shape of a crescent until it reaches the stone, and, once the stone is found, remove it if possible with appropriate instruments; then close the incision quickly at that time, and heal it until it is cured.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause of the inflammation in the ear is one of the growths that swells and inflames, then administer its cure and extraction; but if you do not obey this method, then you should take a thin, subtle spatum according to this method:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	And administer with that the excision of that growth which has fallen into the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do this when you think that it is already moistened by the ear's vapor, and put it in small pieces, and remove them with tweezers or with a subtle gesture, or with an incision as we have said, because the extraction is then easier.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But for water that has entered the ear, the patient should use sneezing, with caution at the beginning, and fill the ear with old cotton, and lie on the ear that has water in it. If the water is thus expelled, it is good; if not, then take smooth small stones, the length of a finger, heat them slightly in the fire, and the patient puts one into the ear canal and steps on that foot of that side, and strikes with another stone on the stone that is within the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore, do not cease with the stone until all the water is expelled.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc i, e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And when the water is expelled in this way, you take paper or linen, place one end in the ear, and heat the other end with fire until the majority of it is burned.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then put in more linen, and do this as many times as necessary until all the water is expelled, and remove it with a cannula as described above for the stone extraction.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the extraction of a beast entering the ear, if it is small, like a tick or similar, treat it as we said in the division; but if it is a large creature that appears within the ear itself, then perform its extraction with forceps and hooks, and its removal is easier than all the other things that happen in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of a worm generated in the ear, when you treat it with what we have said in the division and in the treatise on distillations and your treatment doesn't work, then you must expose the ear to the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And thus, if any creature of the worms appears there, then extract it with fine forceps or hooks; but if no creature appears, then take a cannula that is narrow at the bottom and wide at the top, of which this is the form:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And introduce the narrow end into the ear according to how much the patient can tolerate; and then, with a strong suction, suck with it, and do this many times, until all the worms are expelled.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if it does not yield to this treatment, then you should seal and close the area around the cannula with wax, as we have said; then administer distillations, which the ancients have already tested in the treatment of worms, and you will find this in the treatise on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let your application be with which you pour the medicinal oils into the ear with this instrument, of which this is the form:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make it of silver or brass, narrow at the bottom, with a small hole, and broad at the top.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And then it should be like a pump, so that what is within the cavity of the cannula is continuously pushed where it is needed.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take the reed and wrap its end properly with cotton, then pour oil into the cavity of the instrument, or the juice of some herb, or whatever other medicine you desire, into the cannula—and that is in the ear—then insert the reed with the cotton on top, and squeeze with your hand gently until the oil is expelled into the cavity of the instrument and the patient feels the oil within.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And whatever is put into the ear should first be slightly warmed over a fire.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And be careful that the substance you are distilling into the ear is not too cold, for ear medicines do not tolerate that.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of the treatment of ear obstructions.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Sometimes, children get this from their mothers' wombs; it also happens in some men, an obstruction in the ear canal due to a plaque or fleshy growth; and this obstruction sometimes forms at the opening of the ear, preventing the passage of sound, and sometimes it's in the external parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which occurs at the opening, preventing sound from passing, is in the most difficult conditions for treatment.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in those cases where sound passes through, you should place the patient's ear towards the sun and observe it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore, if obstruction appears, open it with a subtle instrument, of which this is its form:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If its extremity has a small width, one part sharp and the other not; and the instrument has two loops to avoid harming the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And therefore, if the obstruction is due to flesh growing in the ear or its passage, then remove it with fine tweezers and carefully cut away all the flesh until it is gone.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the obstruction is in the [ear] canal, then take a fine, thin [stick/rod] and slightly heat it with fire, and then place it into the ear canal.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And therefore, if you have felt obstruction making hearing difficult for the patient, gently relieve the pressure; and be careful not to injure the ear's nerves.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then place a cloth, sized to fit the hole you have made, soaked in Egyptian ointment, inside the ear.  Do this for several days until you're sure the wound is healed.  Or, take a herb, grind it into powder, and apply it to the area. If the ear is already suppurating, you must remove the herb and replace it with another one wrapped in a bandage made from warmed oil until the suppuration subsides; then treat it further until healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if bleeding occurs, then soak a sponge or cloth in cold water and place it on the ear, and use another treatment to staunch the bleeding, as described in the treatise on [blood]letting.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Of the treatment of [a condition] called "athezil" that affects the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athezil, which sometimes affects the eyelids of the eyes, is sometimes moist, sometimes dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, you should hold them with forceps or tweezers, and cut them off with a knife from their roots, and then apply a compress to the areas.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if pain with bleeding occurs, then cauterize those areas with a small, lens-shaped cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is near the incisions, and often they return if any cause remains from their roots; and when they are cauterized with fire, those roots are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment of swelling that occurs on the eyelids.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Often a cause similar to a swelling in its strength and hardness is found in the eyelids, and thus it is called swelling.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is a buildup of thick moisture on the eyelid, both above and below.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the treatment is to consider if the swelling originates from something external to the eyelid and spreads outward; and the cause of it is light/minor.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore, make a slit over it along its width, and then gently scrape it from all sides until it subsides, then support it with a bandage and excise it.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you are not prepared for an incision, and can only penetrate the eyelid gradually, then that will not help in any way.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the swelling is large, then you treat it with sutures; and heal it until it is cured.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, you will not have any trouble because the ointment will restore it and cause it to heal.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the swelling is receding towards the inner part of the eyelid, away from the surface, then elevate the eyelid, support the swelling with a bandage, other than if you intend to make an incision, and press it from every side.  If the eyelid is incised, this will not help in any way.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And after the incision, wash the wound with salt water, and treat the area with something that promotes healing until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Of the treatment of a boil on the eyelid above the eye.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	A boil is a sore that develops within the eyelid tissues above the eye, and it is more common in children, worsening the eyes of those afflicted and causing difficulty in the morning; and they cannot see the sunlight clearly because tears accumulate there.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And therefore, you often see them lying on their faces all the time, and they sleep on their faces; and the eyelids below their eyebrows are moist, which are already covered by inflammation, and the presence of a boil is apparent in the eye; and when you press the area with your fingers, you feel a boil there.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And a method of operation is this: have the patient rest their head on your lap, then place a cloth over them and heat it, and make a circle of it according to the size that contains the boil on all sides.  Then place this over it and press with your fingers everywhere so the boil is contained within the circle.  Then make a small incision in the middle of the moist area, using a lancet, with a slit not wider than the incision made during a bloodletting procedure.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	However, in the beginning, you must break open the boil completely until you reach the boil, for in most cases the boil progresses through an incision, following the form of a white pus.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Then remove that pus with cloths that you wrapped around your fingers on the outside and rub it back and forth between your right and left hand until it has disappeared.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful not to press too hard on the incision, so that with the lancet you do not pierce the vessel and damage it.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	However, if no boil appears at the beginning of the incision, but you feel a slight pressure on the incision that produces pus; then remove the pus as we described earlier;  then soak cloths in warm water and vinegar and place them over the area and compress them with powders.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And some put salt and bread in the cavity of the incision so that the remaining moisture is absorbed.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a hot abscess in the area, then treat it with cooling plasters until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Of methods of touching the eye.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When in the eyelids of the eyes, there are pimples/inflammation  that arise beneath the natural skin and become hardened, then these attack the eye and cause ailments such as constant tears and softening of the eyelids and tissues, until this causes destruction of the eye, which is called "tactinir of the eye."  It is treated in four ways: either by cautery with fire; or with a sharp medicine, as previously mentioned in the chapter on cautery; or by cutting and stitching the tactinir; or by means of canes, as I will explain.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And therefore, you should place the patient's head on your lap; then gently turn the eyelid with your left hand, and if it turns, that's good; and if not, insert a needle into that part that is furthest below the eyelid, and push the needle with the thread through it, and this should be — near the edge of the eyelid where the hairs grow — close to the hairs, and pull the thread to the top through the eyelid, and turn the eyelid with the instrument.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	And then, in the part inside the eyelid beneath the hardened hairs, make small incisions with the major lacrimal instrument down to the minor lacrimal instrument; then pull out the thread and place small powder of cotton or cloth under the eyelid, and then press on the eyelid with a tenaculum, and shape it like a myrtle leaf.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	However, the shape should be according to the degree of elevation of the eyelid, for this varies greatly in people, for some require a large incision in the eyelid according to the degree to which the eyelid is softened.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	And then, using the instrument, make incisions along the two lines you have marked, beginning at the major lacrimal and continuing to the minor lacrimal.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your incision is near the natural hairs, it should be as wide as the king's finger.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And then, place the forceps at one of the two corners of the wound, and then scrape the entire area; then, using the suture, join the two edges of the wound together with a thin wool thread or thread, and clean the blood; and if you wish, affix the excess thread to the two eyebrows with certain adhesive substances, otherwise do not bother.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And then leave the stitches of thread in place for three or four days, and then treat the wound.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you wish, leave the wound without stitches, and treat it with things that dry and constrict, for the eyelid is lifted by the sealing of the wound and its adherence; but stitching is better.  Therefore, the ancients say this.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	However, be diligent about the patient, and it is a good operation, and there is no fear for the patient.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And there is another method in treating this, and it is that you should shape the eyelid like a myrtle leaf, and then lift the eyelid with three separated and joined forceps in this manner:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if that is not possible, holding the forceps, and that is not suitable, then take a needle with thread and place it in the middle of the shape, and insert the other thread near the larger tear duct, and the second thread near the smaller tear duct, and adjust the threads equally between your fingers, and then with those, lift your hand in a suitable lift, raise the entire eyelid on which it is marked as we have described.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bring together the two edges of the wound with stitches, and treat it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	But if an abscess occurs near your incision or fissure, treat that abscess with plasters and similar things, and with ointments.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And sometimes the eyelashes on the eyelid need to be removed, in which case you should use what we have said about incisions; but stitching in such cases is more artificial.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	To treat with canes is according to this form:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And you must turn the eyelid inside out and cut the figure inside it as I have described; and then, by art, make two thin canes or splints whose length corresponds to the length of the eyelid and whose width is less than the width of the gap.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already incised at the extremities of each part, where you have the threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then carefully attach each one to the excess of the eyelid of the eye, and tightly bind the canes in each part, and leave it for a few days, because the flesh will die from the tightness and will be rejected and decompose until it falls off by itself.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if it has been delayed, then break it with forceps, and then treat the wound until it is healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	Therefore, once it is consolidated, the eyelid is raised, and the skin is not irritated.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the method for the two canes, which you will make according to this form:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and have the quantity of length and width neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	Of lifting irritated skin from a wound with a needle when the skin is hardened.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When there are unnatural, hard, rough, and irritating hairs in the wounds, then the operation for them is that you take a fine needle and put it on a fine linen or silk, and then carefully fit its ends together, each in a very subtle manner.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And the length of the threads should be about the length of one palm.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then you carefully attach another fine thread underneath, and use the ends of that if you want.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And then position the patient's head on your lap, and let it be near the light so that your work is clear, for it is a delicate and minute operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then insert the needle into the root of the attached hair, which needs dexterity, and swiftly penetrate the eyelid until you remove that hair from above the natural hair.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull the hair out above it and place it in the forceps, and let there be one, two, or three hairs, and no more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand with it until the hair is pulled out, along with the forceps and the natural hair from the eyelid.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if the forceps is pulled and the hair is not removed, you will pull the forceps in different directions with the ointment that you have prepared, until the hair is pulled out of the wound.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And close it with the vision of the eye, because then you will remove the forceps and the ointment, and everyone will wash and close the eye, and leave it closed for two or three days, until the hair adheres to its place and healthy flesh grows over it.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the hair is shorter, then you attach a long hair from the natural hairs, and lift it up with that, or leave it until it extends approximately some distance, and then lift it.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	Of the treatment of an abrasion which comes on the upper eyelid.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When an abrasion occurs on the eye, and the eyelid is contracted upward, either on the right or left side, due to poor healing of a wound, incision, or cauterization, and is called a harelip, this abrasion or is natural or accidental, and is caused by the healing of a wound, incision, or cauterization, or by similar poorly healed injuries.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The method of treatment in such a case is to break up the scar tissue and separate the lip edges.  Place a piece of linen cloth between them and tie them together until they heal.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And you should not use treatments that dry or constrict; for if you do, the abrasion will return worse than it ever was before.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use remedies that soften, such as fenugreek, and apply a poultice made from water steeped with mallow and flax seeds, or diachylon ointment, which has been liquefied with an oil.  Dip the cloth into this and apply it as a treatment.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	The key to your treatment is to break apart any unhealed scar tissue, returning it to its original form.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation, which we have described, is simply a way of correcting the abrasion so that the area returns to its former shape.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Of the treatment of an abrasion that occurs on the lower eyelid.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This abrasion on the lower eyelid, properly called an abrasion, may be either a natural or an accidental affliction.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	But accidental abrasions are caused by blows, cuts, cauterization, or similar injuries.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	And the method of treating it is that you take a needle with a double thread, and insert it into the flesh, and pass it from the left tear duct to the right tear duct, until the thread reaches both extremities of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	Then spread the flesh apart with the needle and stitch it with the needle, and cut with a wide scalpel.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And if the eyelid returns to its proper shape, so much the better; and if not, take a thread and place it in the slit, and with it, close the eyelid, and bind the two fissures together at the lower eyelid.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And let the extremities of the two fissures be at two angles of the incision you have made, meeting, and forming an angle where they come together.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this figure is the Greek letter: lambda.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	And now remove the flesh, in the amount that is the lower sharp edge of the eyelid.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	Then bring together the separated parts and sew them with the wool thread; and then treat them with the softening medicines and poultices we mentioned until it is healed.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	And if it needs to be repaired by incision, suture, or cautery, then you should make a flat incision on the skin of the eyelid, as previously described.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	Then separate with a poultice between the two lips, as we have said.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In summary, when treating an eye injury (alxacrati), whether above or below, the procedure should follow the preparation of the eye injury, which can present in various forms.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the skilled artisan always prepares in every possible way until the form returns to its natural, or nearly natural, state, and the patient according to what is appropriate for the operation and the instruments in the best conditions.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Of the adhesion of the eyelid to the conjunctiva or cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When you encounter this adhesion in many people, so that the eyelid is firmly glued to the white of the eye, and the natural movement and function are hindered, then you must insert the tip of a probe under the eyelid, and lift or extend it with forceps.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	And then you carefully dissect the adhesion with a thin, blunt-edged instrument, so that the incision is not sharp and the patient is not disturbed by the operation.  Leave the instrument in place to avoid injuring the eye with its sharpness.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And your incision should carefully sever the adhesion until the eyelid returns to its natural form and all adhesion is removed.

Then carefully separate the eyelid from the eye with a gentle hand, and apply wool soaked in egg white to the eye.  After three days, use healing remedies until healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	Of the incision of a toenail and the protruding flesh of the tear ducts.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	Know that a toenail is of two types: one is nervous, and resembles a hard, fine splinter; or it is non-nervous, resembling frozen white moisture, which when the iron touches it, or is forced to be picked up with forceps, is detached and the forceps do not get stuck in it.
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	And both types originate from the larger tear duct, gradually extending to cover the eye and obstructing the light and movement of the eye.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	But the method of operating on it is that the patient places their head on your lap, then opens their eyes, and you raise the eyelid with your hand, and then grasp the nail with forceps of little bending and pull it away from the surrounding area.

Then take a needle and insert a piece of horsehair, or oxhair, or cowhair, or similar, or strong thread, or gradually twist the tip of the needle and place it in the middle of the toenail, and pierce it with the needle, and tie the nail with the thread; and pull it away from the surrounding area, and scrape away the piece of nail that is obscuring the pupil.

And then you cut the remainder at the root of the tear duct with a fine spatula or small scissors, and leave the natural tissue of the tear duct intact so that cutting it does not cause a continuous flow of tears.

This is the form/shape of it:
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	And be careful that with the spatula you do not touch the cornea and cause a rupture, and that the pupil is not pierced.

After the incision, put a little powdered salt or a prepared powder into the wound, and leave it there until the next day; then treat it with whatever is appropriate until it is healed.

am subtilitat.	with subtlety.
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	And if it is often thin and inflamed and has spread to the surrounding area, then apply a distillation from your apothecary's preparation or rose-colored ointment or powdered salt to the wound and cover it until the next day.

De inscizio de alguazardenic e de aquo que es nascut de carn ajustada en le huel.	Of the incision of the ulcer and what arises from flesh adhering to the wound.

However, you should avoid any treatment of the wound by natural or accidental means, working with iron, and do not put your hand into any of these operations until you see that that member is enduring the operation.

De colleccio de sabel en le huel.	Of the collection of pus in the wound.
Sabel so venas rogas las quals son testudas sobre le huel e prohibeysso al vesement la sua operacio, e develican le huel am longitut de dias.	Pus comes from red veins that are crusted over the wound and prevents its healing, and the wound should be treated for many days.
Donc necessari es al comensament que tu consideres si le huel en le qual es sabel es fort e en lu no es autra malautia que sabel, lahoras tu colligeys aquel sabel.	Therefore, it is necessary at the beginning that you consider if the wound in which there is pus is strong and has no other illness than pus, then you collect that pus.
E es que tu comandes al malaute que pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop suspen aquelas venas am un onci o am dos segon la tua prudencia; e sia aquel onci de subtil duplicacio segon aquesta forma:	And you should tell the patient to place their head on your lap, and then restrain those veins with an ounce or two, according to your judgment; and that ounce should be of a subtle, twofold application, in this way:
o so dos oncis gradantment en un cos segon aquesta forma:	or two ounces gradually in one vessel, according to this form:
E aprop sian colligidas aquelas venas am forses subtils, am subtilitat, e abstergeys le sanc hora aprop hora, entro que vegas aquelas venas esser remaugudas del huel e sian revolgudas.	And then those veins should be collected with subtle forces, subtly, and the blood should be wiped away hour by hour, until you see those veins pulled away from the wound and are rolled up.
